intro: Argostemma quarantena, commonly known as the four-leaf arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a waxy surface, and its flowers are typically greenish-yellow with a prominent spadix. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
